book.irregular_implements.guide.blocks.b: [#](AA00AA)Biome Blocks[#]() are a set of building blocks that [#](00AAAA)tint themselves to match the biome[#]().

There are 6 Biome blocks:
- [#](AA00AA)Biome Glass[#]()
- [#](AA00AA)Biome Stone[#]()
- [#](AA00AA)Biome Cobblestone[#]()
- [#](AA00AA)Biome Stone Bricks[#]()
- [#](AA00AA)Chiseled Biome Stone Bricks[#]()
- [#](AA00AA)Cracked Biome Stone Bricks[#]()
book.irregular_implements.guide.blocks.c:
The [#](AA00AA)Chat Detector[#]() will emit a redstone pulse when the block's owner sends a specific chat message. \
  \
Use the block to open its gui, where you can type a [#](00AAAA)regex pattern[#]() that will be tested on every message the owner sends. \
  \
You don't have to do any fancy regex, though. The regex "example" will match any chat message that contains the word "example". \
  \
Its owner is automatically set to the player who placed it.

In its menu, you can also set it to [#](00AAAA)consume[#]() the message. \
  \
If enabled, the message will not actually be sent to chat, but will still emit a redstone pulse.

The [#](AA00AA)Contact Button[#]() acts like a Stone Button, but instead of clicking _it_, you click the block it's facing. \
  \
That is, if the Contact Button is facing up, clicking the block above it will make it emit a redstone signal.

The [#](AA00AA)Contact Lever[#]() acts like a Lever, but instead of clicking _it_, you click the block it's facing. \
  \
That is, if the Contact Lever is facing up, clicking the block above it will toggle if it emits a redstone signal.
book.irregular_implements.guide.blocks.g:
The [#](AA00AA)Global Chat Detector[#]() works like the [Chat Detector](entry://blocks/chat_detector), but works for all players. \
  \
In its menu, you can also supply up to 9 [ID Cards](entry://items/id_card).
If the GCD is set to consume messages, it will only consume messages sent from the players set by the ID Cards.
book.irregular_implements.guide.blocks.l: [#](AA00AA)Lapis Glass[#]() is a special type of glass that is solid for players, but [#](00AAAA)everything else will pass through[#]().
book.irregular_implements.guide.blocks.n:
When the [#](AA00AA)Notification Interface[#]() receives a redstone signal, it will [#](00AAAA)display a notification toast[#]() in the top right of the owner's screen. \
  \
Its menu has 2 text boxes, one for the title and one for the description.
You can set the toast's icon by inserting an item into the slot on the left.
book.irregular_implements.guide.blocks.o: The [#](AA00AA)Online Detector[#]() will emit a redstone signal when the set player is online.
Right-click it to open its menu, where you can type the player's username.
book.irregular_implements.guide.blocks.p:
The [#](AA00AA)Pitcher Plant[#]() is a flower that [#](00AAAA)acts as an infinite source of water[#](). \
  \
It also occasionally [#](00AAAA)fills adjacent tanks[#]() with water!
It can be found in biomes with the tag [#](00AAAA)#c:is_wet/overworld[#](), most notably Swamps and Jungles.
book.irregular_implements.guide.blocks.q: [#](AA00AA)Quartz Glass[#]() is a special type of glass that [#](00AAAA)players pass through[#](), but is solid for everything else.
book.irregular_implements.guide.blocks.r:
The [#](AA00AA)Rain Shield[#]() will [#](00AAAA)prevent rain in a 5 chunk radius[#](). \
  \
This radius can be changed in the server config.
You can disable it by providing a redstone signal!
The [#](AA00AA)Rainbow Lamp[#]() will be a different color for each possible redstone signal strength (0-15).
book.irregular_implements.guide.blocks.s:
The [#](AA00AA)Shock Absorber[#]() will [#](00AAAA)absorb fall damage[#](). \
  \
Additionally, the higher the fall, the greater a redstone signal it emits.
The [#](AA00AA)Sided Block of Redstone[#]() emits power from only one of its sides.

The [#](AA00AA)Spectre Lens[#]() can be placed on Beacons to [#](00AAAA)allow them to effect you no matter the distance.[#]() \
  \
However, you [#](FF5555)must be in the same dimension[#]() as the Lens, and it must be loaded.
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.bi:
The [#](AA00AA)Biome Capsule[#]() works with the [Biome Painter](entry://items/biome_painter) to [#](00AAAA)change the biome of an area[#](). \
  \
Throw a Biome Capsule on the ground, and it will start [#](00AAAA)generating Biome Points for the biome it's in[#](), storing it in the Capsule.
Found in [#](00AAAA)dungeon chests[#](), [#](AA00AA)Biome Crystals[#]() are meant to be used in the [Biome Radar](entry://blocks/biome_radar) to locate specific biomes.

There's a Biome Crystal for almost every biome in the game. \
  \
However, any biome with the tag [#](FF5555)#irregular_implements:biome_crystal_blacklist[#]() are excluded.
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.bl: The [#](AA00AA)Blaze and Steel[#]() lights a [#](00AAAA)much more aggressive fire[#]().

The [#](AA00AA)Block Mover[#]() can be used to [#](00AAAA)pick up and place blocks[#](), including block entities! \
  \
Right-click a block to pick it up, and right-click the ground to place it back down.
Unbreakable blocks, as well as blocks that have the tag #irregular_implements:block_mover_blacklist, cannot be picked up.
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.bo: The [#](AA00AA)Bottle of Air[#]() can be used underwater to refill your air supply.
These can be found in [#](00AAAA)Ocean Monuments[#]()
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.ch:
The [#](AA00AA)Chunk Analyzer[#]() can be used to [#](00AAAA)analyze the contents of a chunk[#](). \
  \
Right-click it to open a menu, which lists all the blocks in the chunk, and their quantities.
It will also list all the [#](00AAAA)entities[#]() in the chunk as well!
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.di:
When held in your hand, the [#](AA00AA)Divining Rod[#]() will [#](00AAAA)show you nearby ores through walls[#](). \
  \
It has a 20 block radius by default, though this can be configured.
There is a Divining Rod for [#](00AAAA)each ore[#](), as well as one that shows [#](00AAAA)all ores[#]().
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.dr:
The [#](AA00AA)Drop Filter[#]() can be used to [#](00AAAA)prevent certain items from being picked up[#](). \
  \
Use it to open its menu, and insert an [Item Filter](entry://items/item_filter).
The [#](AA00AA)Voiding Drop Filter[#]() works similarly, but [#](00AAAA)destroys the items instead[#]().
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.em: The [#](AA00AA)Emerald Compass[#]() can be used to locate players.
Craft it with a [Player Filter](entry://items/player_filter), and it will point to the player the Player Filter is set to.
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.en:
The [#](AA00AA)Ender Bucket[#]() can pick up fluids [#](00AAAA)when used on non-source blocks[#](). \
  \
It'll search for the nearest source block and pick that up instead.
The [#](AA00AA)Reinforced Ender Bucket[#]() works similarly, but [#](00AAAA)can hold 10 fluid sources[#]()!

[#](AA00AA)Entity Filters[#]() can be used to filter entities in several places. \
  \
Use it on an entity to save its type to the Filter. Use it while not looking at an entity to set it to players.
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.es:
The [#](AA00AA)Escape Rope[#]() can be used to [#](00AAAA)teleport you out of caves[#]() quickly. \
  \
It does this by attempting to pathfind to anywhere that has a clear view of the sky. \
  \
Hold right-click to continue the search, and it'll either succeed on its own or fail after enough time.

On success, it will [#](FF5555)damage the item[#](), with a maximum of 20 uses. \
  \
On fail, it'll simply be dropped out of your hands.
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.ev:
The [#](AA00AA)Evil Tear[#]() allows you to create an [#](00AAAA)Artificial End Portal[#](). \
  \
Make a 3x3 platform of End Stone, and make a 5x5 ring of Obsidian one block above it. \
  \
Five blocks above the center End Stone, place another End Stone, with an End Rod on its bottom.
Use an Evil Tear on the End Rod to open the portal.
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.gr: [#](AA00AA)Grass Seeds[#]() can be used to [#](00AAAA)spread grass[#]().
There are also [#](AA00AA)16 colored variants[#](), which can be used to spread colored grass.
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.it:
[#](AA00AA)Item Filters[#]() can be used to filter items in several places. \
  \
Use it to open its menu, which has 9 slots. Insert an item into a slot to add it to the filter. \
  \
There are two buttons above each non-empty slot. The left button toggles if that slot filters by [#](00AAAA)Item[#]() or [#](00AAAA)Item Tag[#]().

The right button does one of two things. \
  \
If the slot is filtering by Item, then it toggles if it requires the item to have the same [#](00AAAA)components[#](). \
  \
If the slot is filtering by Tag, then it cycles which tag it's filtering. \
  \
Additionally, you can set the entire filter to be a [#](00AAAA)blacklist[#]() or [#](00AAAA)whitelist[#]() using the button on the top right.
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.lo:
The [#](AA00AA)Location Filter[#]() is an item representation of a location in the world. \
  \
Use it on a block to save its location to the Filter. Sneak right-click to clear it.
Holding it in your hand will show the location you set!
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.ma: The [#](AA00AA)Magic Hood[#]() disables your name plate and hides your potion particles.
It can only be found in [#](00AAAA)dungeon chests[#]() and [#](00AAAA)blacksmith village buildings[#]().
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.pl:
[#](AA00AA)Player Filter[#]() can be used to [#](00AAAA)identify players[#](). \
  \
Use it on a player to set it to them, or use it while not looking at a player to set it to you.
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.po:
The [#](AA00AA)Portkey[#]() can be bound to a location and then [#](00AAAA)teleports anyone who picks it up[#]() after it's been dropped. \
  \
Use it on a block to set its location. After dropping it, it'll activate after a short delay. You can tell it's active when it stops glowing.
You can craft the Portkey with any other item to [#](00AAAA)disguise it[#](), making it look like that item.
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.sp: [#](AA00AA)Spectre Anchors[#]() can be crafted with any item to anchor them to you, allowing them to [#](00AAAA)be kept on death[#]().
After the items are returned to you, [#](FF5555)the Spectre Anchor is consumed[#]().
[#](AA00AA)Spectre Armor[#]() is comparable to Diamond, but has [#](00AAAA)higher durability and enchantability.[#]()
It also makes you slightly transparent!
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.st:
The [#](AA00AA)Stable Ender Pearl[#]() functions somewhat differently to a regular Ender Pearl. \
  \
When right-clicked, instead of throwing the Pearl, it instead [#](00AAAA)binds the Pearl to you[#](). \
  \
When dropped, after a short delay, the Pearl will [#](00AAAA)teleport you to its location[#]().
If the Pearl has not been bound to anything, it will instead grab a random Entity within 10 blocks, and teleport that instead.
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.su:
The [#](AA00AA)Summoning Pendulum[#]() can be used to pick up and place entities. \
  \
Right-click an entity to pick it up, right-click the ground to place it down.
book.irregular_implements.guide.items.vo:
The [#](AA00AA)Void Stone[#]() is essentially a portable trash can. \
  \
Open its menu, and any items inserted will be deleted.
book.irregular_implements.guide.name: Irregular Implements Instructional Index
book.irregular_implements.guide.tooltip: A guide to all things genetic
death.fell.accident.fluid_fall.boot: %s splattered against the surface of %s because they were wearing %s
death.fell.accident.fluid_fall.generic: %s splattered against the surface of %s because they could walk on it
enchantment.irregular_implements.magneti: Teleports fresh item drops towards you
info.irregular_implements.accelerator_pl: Entities moving on this Plate are sped up slightly, to a limit.
info.irregular_implements.advanced_item_:
Collects items in a configurable radius and inserts it into the inventory it's placed on.

You can also insert an Item Filter for more control.
info.irregular_implements.advanced_redst:
Powers up to 9 linked blocks with the Redstone signal it's receiving.

Use a Redstone Tool to link it to blocks.
A Redstone Repeater that can have both its Step Up and Step Down delays configured.
A Redstone Torch that can have its Powered and Unpowered output strengths configured
info.irregular_implements.analog_emitter: Emits a Redstone signal with a configurable strength when the front face is powered.
info.irregular_implements.auto_placer:
Places blocks in front of it from its inventory.

Can be disabled with a Redstone signal.
info.irregular_implements.basic_redstone:
Powers the linked block with the Redstone signal it's receiving.

Use a Redstone Tool to link it to a block.
info.irregular_implements.bean_pod:
Found at the top of a grown Magic Bean.

Contains loot!
info.irregular_implements.biome_blocks: Changes color to match the biome.
info.irregular_implements.biome_capsule:
Throw on the ground, and it will capture the biome it lands in.

Used in conjunction with the Biome Painter.
info.irregular_implements.biome_crystal: Found in dungeon chests, can be inserted into a Biome Radar to locate a biome.
info.irregular_implements.biome_painter:
Use it on a block, and it will paint the biome of the first Biome Capsule in your inventory.

The radius can be configured.
info.irregular_implements.biome_radar:
Insert a Biome Crystal and provide a Redstone signal, and it will attempt to find the Crystal's biome.

If it succeeds, it will spawn particles aiming in its direction.

Using a Paper on it will create a Location Filter for the biome.
info.irregular_implements.blackout_powde: Removes the Spectre Illuminator in the chunk it's used in.
info.irregular_implements.blaze_and_stee: Lights a much more aggressive Fire.
info.irregular_implements.block_breaker:
Breaks blocks in front of it with the effectiveness of an Iron Pickaxe. Drops are inserted into the inventory behind it, or dropped.

Can be disabled with a Redstone signal.

Can be upgraded with a Diamond Breaker.
info.irregular_implements.block_destabil:
When given a Redstone pulse, scans the blocks in front of it.

It then gives the nearest 50 connected blocks gravity, making them fall.

You can set it to "lazy" mode, which makes it remember the shape, and only destabilize those blocks.
info.irregular_implements.block_mover:
Use on a block to pick it up, and use it again to place it.

Can be used on blocks with Block Entities, like Chests and machines.
info.irregular_implements.block_of_stick: Cheap building material that automatically breaks after 10 seconds.
info.irregular_implements.block_replacer:
Stores up to 9 stacks of blocks. When used on a block, it gets replaced with a random stored block.

Sneak right-click to open its inventory.
info.irregular_implements.bottle_of_air:
Refills your breath.

Can be found in Ocean Monuments.
info.irregular_implements.bouncy_plate: Entities on this Plate are propelled upwards.
info.irregular_implements.chat_detector: Emits a Redstone pulse if the block's owner sends a chat message containing some specified text.
info.irregular_implements.chunk_analyzer: When used, shows you all the blocks and entities in the chunk you're in.
info.irregular_implements.collection_pla:
Dropped item entities that pass over this Plate attempt to insert into adjacent inventories.

The order it tries is: Down, North, South, East, West, Up
info.irregular_implements.compressed_sli:
Create by clicking a Slime Block with a Shovel. Can be compressed multiple times.

Launches entities into the air.
info.irregular_implements.contact_button: Acts like a Button, but works when the block in front of it is clicked instead.
info.irregular_implements.contact_lever: Acts like a Lever, but works when the block in front of it is clicked instead.
info.irregular_implements.corrector_plat:
Entities moving on the Plate are centered along the axis they're moving.

For example, if they're moving South, they're teleported to the middle of the North-South axis of the block.
info.irregular_implements.custom_craftin:
Works exactly like a vanilla Crafting Table, except it looks like the block it's made of.

This uses the item tag #irregular_implements:custom_crafting_table_items
info.irregular_implements.diamond_breake:
Apply to a Block Breaker to increase its mining level to equivalent to a Diamond Pickaxe.

Can also be enchanted!
info.irregular_implements.diaphanous_blo:
Looks like another block, but becomes transparent as you approach.

Craft it with any block to set its appearance.

Craft it by itself to invert it, so it starts transparent and becomes opaque.
info.irregular_implements.directional_ac: Entities on this Plate are pushed slightly in the direction the Plate is facing.
info.irregular_implements.divining_rod:
When held in hand, highlights the corresponding ore if it's within 20 blocks of you.

This radius can be configured.
info.irregular_implements.drop_filter: Filters out items that match the contained Item Filters from entering your inventory.
info.irregular_implements.ectoplasm:
Every time an entity dies, it has a chance of spawning a Spirit.

Spirits can only be killed by magic, and they drop Ectoplasm.

Can also be harvested from Spectre Trees.
info.irregular_implements.emerald_compas:
Points to the set player, if they are online.

Set the player by crafting with a Player Filter.
info.irregular_implements.ender_anchor: Destination point for the Ender Bridge or Prismarine Ender Bridge.
info.irregular_implements.ender_bridge:
Upon the Ender Bridge receiving a Redstone Signal, it looks for an Ender Anchor in front of it.

It searches at 20 blocks per second, and then teleports the player standing on top to it.

There's no distance limit, though there can be no blocks between (save for the block directly in front of the Bridge).
info.irregular_implements.ender_bucket: When used on a non-source fluid, it picks up the nearest source.
info.irregular_implements.ender_letter:
Can be used to send items and messages to other players.

Type the name of the player at the top, and insert up to 9 items.

Click an Ender Mailbox, and it will be inserted into their Ender Mailbox if it has room.
info.irregular_implements.ender_mailbox: Allows players to send and receive Ender Letters.
info.irregular_implements.entity_detecto: Emits a Redstone signal if a configured entity is within a configured range.
info.irregular_implements.entity_filter: Allows you to filter by entity type. Do so by using it on an entity.
info.irregular_implements.escape_rope:
Hold right-click to begin searching for the nearest location that can see the sky.

If it finds one, it'll teleport you there.
info.irregular_implements.evil_tear:
Can be used on a specific structure to make an Artificial End Portal.

Place an End Stone, and place an End Rod under it.

4 blocks below it, build a 3x3 of End Stone, with a 5x5 ring of Obsidian one block above it.

Use the Evil Tear on the End Rod to complete the structure.
info.irregular_implements.extraction_pla:
Has an "input" side and an "output" side. Extracts stacks from the input side, and drops or inserts them on the output side, depending on if there's an inventory there.

Right-click with an empty hand to change the output side, and do so while sneaking to change the input side.
info.irregular_implements.fertilized_dir:
Fertilized Dirt does not require hydration, grows crops 3 times faster, and can't be trampled.

You still have to till it with a Hoe to grow crops.
info.irregular_implements.filtered_redir:
Has two "input" sides, and two color-coded "output" sides.

Both output sides have a slot for an Entity Filter, and any entity that enters from the input sides are teleported to the output with a matching Filter.
info.irregular_implements.global_chat_de:
Emits a redstone pulse if any player sends a chat message containing the specified text.

Can have a player whitelist using Player Filterss.
info.irregular_implements.golden_egg:
Spawns a Chicken that lays Gold Ingots rather than Eggs.

Can be found in Bean Pods, which can be found at the top of Bean Stalks grown from Magic Beans.
info.irregular_implements.grass_seeds: Can be planted on Dirt to grow Grass.
info.irregular_implements.igniter:
Sets or extinguishes the block on front of it, depending on the Redstone signal.

Can be set to keep the fire lit.
info.irregular_implements.imbue_collapse:
Inverts your controls.

Why would you want this?
info.irregular_implements.imbue_experien:
Increases experience dropped by entities by 50%%.

Lasts 20 minutes, but you can only have one Imbuement at a time.
info.irregular_implements.imbue_fire:
Sets entities you hit with melee attacks on fire.

Lasts 20 minutes, but you can only have one Imbuement at a time.
info.irregular_implements.imbue_poison:
Inflicts Poison II on entities you hit with melee attacks.

Lasts 20 minutes, but you can only have one Imbuement at a time.
info.irregular_implements.imbue_spectre:
Gives you a configurable chance to fully negate damage.

Lasts 20 minutes, but you can only have one Imbuement at a time.
info.irregular_implements.imbue_wither:
Inflicts Wither II on entities you hit with melee attacks.

Lasts 20 minutes, but you can only have one Imbuement at a time.
info.irregular_implements.inventory_rero:
Each side can be configured to "point" to one side of the block in front.

For example, setting this block's bottom face to "U" will and then inserting items into it will try to insert those items into the top face of the block in front of it.

Also allows for extracting.
info.irregular_implements.inventory_test:
When placed on an inventory, constantly simulates attempting to insert a configured Item Stack.

If the simulation would succeed, it emits a Redstone signal. You can invert this behavior.
info.irregular_implements.iron_dropper:
An upgraded Dropper, where the following can be configured:

• Item pickup delay
• Item motion randomness
• Particle/Sound toggle
• Redstone control
info.irregular_implements.item_collector: Collects items in a 3 block radius and inserts it into the inventory it's placed on.
info.irregular_implements.item_filter: Allows you to filter Item Stacks. Do so in its GUI.
info.irregular_implements.item_rejuvenat: Dropped item entities that pass over this Plate have their despawn timer set to 4 minutes.
info.irregular_implements.item_sealer_pl: Dropped item entities that pass over this Plate cannot be picked up for 30 seconds.
info.irregular_implements.lapis_glass: Solid for players, not solid for anything else.
info.irregular_implements.lava_charm:
Adds a temporary lava shield, visible above your armor bar. This prevents taking damage from Lava, but does NOT prevent you from lighting on fire!

Lasts about 10 seconds.
info.irregular_implements.lava_waders:
Combines the effects of Obsidian Water Walking Boots and a Lava Charm.

Additionally allows you to stand on lava.
info.irregular_implements.lesser_magic_b:
Can be planted on any block, and grows into a bean stalk.

Bean Stalk blocks can be climbed faster than Ladders.
info.irregular_implements.location_filte:
An item representation of a position in the world.

Set by either using it on a block.
info.irregular_implements.lotus_blossom:
Grants experience when consumed.

Sneak to consume the entire stack.
info.irregular_implements.lotus_seeds:
Can be planted to grow Lotus Blossoms.

Lotus plants can be found in cold biomes.
info.irregular_implements.lubricant: Completely frictionless. Anything moving on it will retain its momentum.
info.irregular_implements.luminous_powde: Can be crafted onto items to make them glow in the dark.
info.irregular_implements.magic_bean:
Can be planted on any block, and grows a bean stalk that reaches the sky.

The top of the bean stalk has treasures.
info.irregular_implements.magic_hood: Disables your name plate and potion particles.
info.irregular_implements.magnetic_encha: Teleports fresh item drops towards you.
info.irregular_implements.moon_phase_det: Emits a Redstone signal depending on the current moon phase.
info.irregular_implements.notification_i: Sends a configurable toast notification to the block's owner when a Redstone signal is received.
info.irregular_implements.obsidian_skull:
Has a chance of negating fire damage.

The chance is higher the lower the damage would be.
Works like the Obsidian Skull, but can be worn as a Curio.
info.irregular_implements.obsidian_water: Combines the effects of the Obsidian Skull and Water Walking Boots.
info.irregular_implements.online_detecto: Emits a Redstone signal if the specified player is online.
info.irregular_implements.peace_candle:
Prevents natural mob spawns in a 3 chunk radius.

Can be found in roughly half of Villager Temples.
info.irregular_implements.pitcher_plant:
Acts as an infinite water source.

Slowly fills adjacent fluid containers.
info.irregular_implements.player_filter:
Acts like an Entity Filter, but specifically for the player set.

Set by using it in your hand.
info.irregular_implements.player_interfa: Exposes the inventory of the block's owner, as if it was the block's inventory.
info.irregular_implements.portable_ender:
Use while looking at an Ender Anchor to teleport to it.

Has a configurable range, defaulting to 300. Requires direct line of sight.
info.irregular_implements.portkey:
Use on a block to set a destination, then throw it on the ground.

After 5 seconds, anyone who picks it up will be teleported to the destination.

You can craft it with any other item to disguise it!
info.irregular_implements.potion_vaporiz:
Allows you to fill a room with a potion effect.

Insert Potions and Furnace fuel, and it will scan the area in front of it to check if it's an enclosed area.

If it is, it'll fill it with the potion effect.
info.irregular_implements.prismarine_end:
Upon the Prismarine Ender Bridge receiving a Redstone Signal, it looks for an Ender Anchor in front of it (with no distance limit, though it must be loaded, and no other blocks can be in the way).

It searches at 200 blocks per second, and then teleports the player standing on top to it.

There's no distance limit, though there can be no blocks between (save for the block directly in front of the Bridge).
info.irregular_implements.rain_shield: Prevents rain in a 5 chunk radius.
info.irregular_implements.rainbow_lamp:
Changes color depending on the Redstone signal strength.

Only the texture changes, the light stays the same color.
info.irregular_implements.redirector_pla: Has two "enabled" sides. Entities that enter from one side are sent to the other side.
info.irregular_implements.redstone_activ:
Using it on a block will give it a temporary Redstone signal.

Use it on the air to change the duration.
info.irregular_implements.redstone_obser:
Emits the same Redstone signal as a linked block.

Use a Redstone Tool to link it to a block.
info.irregular_implements.redstone_plate:
Entities moving over this plate are redirected in a configurable direction.

If powered, they instead move forward.
info.irregular_implements.redstone_remot:
Allows you to temporarily power one of nine blocks from a distance.

Sneak right-click it to open its GUI, where you can place up to 9 Location Filters. Under each you can set an item to represent that position.

Right-click normally to see all the positions it can power.
info.irregular_implements.redstone_tool:
Used to bind the Redstone Observer or Redstone Interfaces to blocks.

Sneak right-click on the Observer/Interface, then click on the block to bind/unbind it.

Also shows the signal strength of the block you're looking at!
info.irregular_implements.reinforced_end:
Works like an Ender Bucket, but can hold 10 sources.

If sneaking, it will pick up as many sources as it can.
info.irregular_implements.returning_bloc: Works like a Block of Sticks, but teleports itself to the nearest player after breaking.
info.irregular_implements.sakanade_spore:
Found on the bottom of huge brown mushrooms.

Touching it inflicts you with Collapse for a short time, which inverts your controls.

This also inverts mobs' movement! They'll move the opposite direction they're trying to.
info.irregular_implements.shock_absorber: Reduces all fall damage, and also emits a redstone signal strength relative to the distance fallen.
info.irregular_implements.sided_redstone: Emits a Redstone signal on only one side.
info.irregular_implements.slime_cube:
Causes Slimes to spawn in great numbers in the chunk its in.

When powered, it instead prevents Slimes from spawning in the chunk.
info.irregular_implements.spectre_anchor: When crafted with an item, the item is kept after death.
info.irregular_implements.spectre_armor:
Comparable to Diamond Armor with higher durability and enchantability.

Also makes you slightly transparent!
info.irregular_implements.spectre_axe:
Comparable to a Diamond Axe with higher durability and enchantability.

Increases the block reach of the player by 3 blocks.
info.irregular_implements.spectre_block: An indestructible block that spawns in the Spectre Dimension.
info.irregular_implements.spectre_charge:
Charges items in your inventory with an infinite amount of energy.

Creative only!
Charge items in your inventory using energy from your Spectre Energy Buffer.
info.irregular_implements.spectre_coil_b:
Outputs FE from the Spectre Energy Buffer, which is filled using Spectre Energy Injectors.

Has a rate of 1,024 FE/t.
info.irregular_implements.spectre_coil_e:
Outputs FE from the Spectre Energy Buffer, which is filled using Spectre Energy Injectors.

Has a rate of 20,480 FE/t.
info.irregular_implements.spectre_coil_g: Generates an infinite amount of FE for free, inserting it into the block it's placed on.
info.irregular_implements.spectre_coil_n: Generates 128 FE/t for free, inserting it into the block it's placed on.
info.irregular_implements.spectre_coil_r:
Outputs FE from the Spectre Energy Buffer, which is filled using Spectre Energy Injectors.

Has a rate of 4,096 FE/t.
info.irregular_implements.spectre_energy:
Acts like an Ender Chest for FE.

FE can be inserted into the Spectre Energy Injector, but Spectre Coils are required to extract it.

A player's Spectre Energy Buffer can store up to 1,000,000 FE by default.
info.irregular_implements.spectre_illumi:
When used, spawns a Spectre Illuminator that lights up the entire chunk.

Can be removed either by clicking the Illuminator, or using Blackout Powder in the chunk.
info.irregular_implements.spectre_key:
Use for 5 seconds to teleport to a private dimension.

Do the same there to return.
info.irregular_implements.spectre_lens:
Place on a Beacon, and its effects will be granted to you no matter the distance.

Only works in the same dimension, and only when the Beacon's chunk is loaded.
info.irregular_implements.spectre_pickax:
Comparable to a Diamond Pickaxe with higher durability and enchantability.

Increases the block reach of the player by 3 blocks.
info.irregular_implements.spectre_saplin:
Created by using Ectoplasm on a Sapling.

Grows into a Spectre Tree, whose blocks have a chance of dropping Ectoplasm.
info.irregular_implements.spectre_shovel:
Comparable to a Diamond Shovel with higher durability and enchantability.

Increases the block reach of the player by 3 blocks.
info.irregular_implements.spectre_sword:
Comparable to a Diamond Sword with higher durability and enchantability.

Increases the entity reach range of the player by 3 blocks, and can be used to kill Spirits.
info.irregular_implements.stable_ender_p:
Use to bind to yourself.

Seven seconds after being dropped, it teleports the bound entity to it. If no entity is bound, it grabs a random entity within 10 blocks instead.
info.irregular_implements.summoning_pend: Found in dungeon chests, can be used to pick up and place entities.
info.irregular_implements.super_lubrican:
Can be applied to any Boots to make you slide when wearing them.

Can be washed with a Water Bottle after.
info.irregular_implements.trigger_glass:
When given a Redstone pulse, loses its collision for 3 seconds.

Also triggers adjacent Trigger Glass.
info.irregular_implements.void_stone: In its menu, has a slot that immediately deletes whatever is inserted.
info.irregular_implements.voiding_drop_f: Works like the Drop Filter, but deletes the items instead of preventing them from entering your inventory.
info.irregular_implements.water_walking_: Allows you to walk on water when not sneaking.
info.irregular_implements.white_stone:
Charges when held while under the full moon. When fully charged, it will prevent your death once and discharges.

Can be found in dungeon loot.
irregular_implements.configuration.biome: Biome Painter Correct Biome Cube Color
Biome Painter Correct Biome Cube Size
Biome Painter Incorrect Biome Cube Color
Biome Painter Incorrect Biome Cube Size
Biome Painter Selected Incorrect Biome Cube Color
irregular_implements.configuration.hideC: Hide Recipe Book Button In Custom Crafting Table
message.irregular_implements.anchor.used: %s was retained through death, but its Spectre Anchor was consumed.
message.irregular_implements.ender_bridg: Ender Bridge stopped searching because it hit a %s at %d %d %d.
Ender Bridge stopped searching after %d blocks.
message.irregular_implements.ender_lette: This letter has already been sent! You can't send it again.
%s has no room for your letter
%s of this letter is not online
message.irregular_implements.ender_mailb: You are not the owner of this Ender Mailbox.
Bugged fireplace; please break and replace it.
The fireplace at %d %d %d is no longer valid.
message.irregular_implements.redstone_to: Redstone Tool linked to the %s at %d %d %d.
Cannot link as base %s was replaced with a %s.
Linked the %s at %d %d %d to the %s at %d %d %d.
Cannot link as no base block is set.
Cannot link as base %s is in an unloaded chunk.
Cannot link as base %s is in a different dimension.
message.irregular_implements.spectre_ill: This chunk already has a Spectre Illuminator!
tooltip.irregular_implements.block_repla: Hold ALT to see stored blocks
Store blocks by right-clicking them on this stack
Remove blocks by right-clicking this stack on empty slots
tooltip.irregular_implements.void_stone_: Currently holding %s, inserting another will void and replace it
Store items by right-clicking them on this stack
You can remove the %s by right-clicking the Stone into an empty slot
